algorithm_technique: Union-Find to group connected emails, then aggregate and sort emails per group.
problem_summary_simple: Merge accounts with common emails and return sorted emails for each person.
problem_summary_technical: Uses Union-Find to connect emails belonging to the same person, then groups and sorts emails by their representative element.
time_complexity: O(N log N), where N is the total number of emails across all accounts.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as finding connected components in a graph where emails are nodes and common ownership creates edges.
Union-Find is an efficient data structure for managing disjoint sets and merging them.
Mapping emails to unique IDs is necessary for the Union-Find operations.
